sub_title: Behavioural ecologist. Passionate about animal behaviour & wildlife conservation. Assistant professor at Wageningen University & Research.
summary:
I am a post-doc in Behavioural Ecology. Curious about the world. Interested in nature conservation, science communication, nature education and changing the world.

The social and spatial dynamics of animal populations are my main research interests. During my first MSc thesis at Wageningen University (Netherlands), I investigated parental care differences between migrating and non-migrating barnacle geese [Thesis prize] and during my second MSc thesis at The Simon Fraser University (Canada), I studied if anthropogenic structures and activities affect the spatial distribution of dabbling ducks in agricultural fields [MSc Cum laude].

I have a special interest in how individuals weigh the risk and benefits of particular situations, for example social situations. As part of my PhD at Wageningen University, I used a novel tracking system and a self-designed video-playback experiment to study the effects of personality on proximity and communication networks in great tits [PhD Cum laude]. 

At the moment I study how social dynamics might link to foraging succes in wild Trinidadian guppies (IGB) and I started a postdoc fellowship at the Leibniz Institute for Zoo and Wildlife Research (IZW) to study personality and migration strategies in noctule bats.

Next to my scientific work, I have always been active in science communication and education. For example, by designing online tools for the Bachelor course Animal Behaviour and by being a co-creater of the free Massive Open Online Course: Introduction to Animal Behaviour on Edx.org. 

Finally, and most importantly, I wish to contribute to a better world. Nature conservation has always been a crucial theme in my professional and personal life. Via volunteering in nature conservation organizations and by sharing the wonders of nature via (social) media, I hope to make people more aware of the amazing natural world around us.

Contact me: lysannesnijders@gmail.com
orcid.org/0000-0003-0911-3418

awards.title: Niko Tinbergen Award
awards.description:
https://www.etho-ges.de/wordpress/awards/

The Ethologische Gesellschaft awards the Niko Tinbergen Award every other year to outstanding post-doc level researchers in behavioural biology or closely related fields. The award entails:

1. A certificate stating the name of the candidate. The certificate is signed by the president of the society;
2  A cheque of 1500 € which is donated by the journal Ethology (Wiley).
3. The recipient is invited to give a keynote talk about their work at ECBB, present an overview in the EthoNews 
4. The recipient is invited to write a review for or organise a special issue in Ethology (Wiley)

awards.title: Klaus Tschira Boost Fund
awards.description: A fund to support promising early career researchers in funding risky research projects that are separate from their day-to-day projects.

awards.title: Humboldt Research Fellowship for Postdoctoral Researchers
awards.description: A personal grant to conduct research at the Leibniz IZW for two years.

awards.title: IGB Postdoc Fellowship
awards.description: A personal grant to conduct postdoctoral research at the IGB for one year

awards.title: WIAS Postdoc Fellowship
awards.description: A 3 month postdoc fellowship to write a research proposal. I was able to get an IGB-Fellowship and Humboldt-Fellowship with the help of this WIAS grant.

awards.title: Wageningen University Innovation Grant
awards.description: A 4 month grant to innovate the Animal Behaviour Course via knowledge clips (MOOC) and online learning tools.

awards.title: Cum laude PhD degree
awards.description: Cum laude at the Wageningen University is awarded to the best 3%. 4 + 2 independent reviewers have to grade the PhD thesis as excellent.

awards.title: Cum laude Master degree
awards.description: Cum laude (honors) is awarded to students who graduate with an 8 (out of 10) or higher, on average and who received a 9 or higher for their Master thesis.

awards.title: Alfred Russel Wallace Award for Master Thesis
awards.description: This award is bestowed once a year for the groups's best Master thesis

profile_positions.description: I was granted an one year IGB postdoc fellowship. My research at IGB will focus on the social dynamic of Trinidadian guppies, both in the wild as in the lab. Starting with three weeks of fieldwork in Trinidad in March. To keep updated, check: www.lysannesnijders.com
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Fellow

profile_positions.description: At the Behavioural Ecology Group of Wageningen University & Research, I continued my academic work as a Behavioural Ecology Researcher. I also stayed active in communicating the science of animal behaviour online (www.naturetoday.com) and participated in nature conservation initiatives, such as the Future For Nature Academy (FFNA) .
profile_positions.title: Guest Researcher

profile_positions.description: I continued my research in animal social networks and communication. I was also happy to contribute to the development of our MOOC Introduction to Animal Behaviour on Edx and to the online innovation of our on campus Animal Behaviour Bachelor course.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher Behavioural Ecology

profile_positions.description: April 29, 2016 I graduated with distinction (best 3%) at Wageningen University & Research. With my project I investigated the role of personality in the social networks of great tits, in cooperation with the Netherlands Institute of Ecology (NIOO-KNAW). I was supervised by Prof. Marc Naguib (WUR) and Dr Kees van Oers (NIOO-KNAW). Throughout my PhD I was also active as organizer of the Wageningen Evolution and Ecology Seminars (WEES: www.weeswageningen.nl)
profile_positions.title: PhD student Behavioural Ecology - Cum laude

volunteer_experiences.description: For several years I volunteered as animal keeper and tour guide at the bird recovery center.

volunteer_experiences.role: Coordinator of a nature education project, Palawan, Philippines
volunteer_experiences.description: For three months I coordinated a nature education project for primary schools on Palawan. The project was focused on sustainable use and conservation of the aquatic environment and included games, movies, presentations and field trips.
Bird ringing on Iona Island, Vancouver, Canada.
Writing about the daily lives of great tits (and the science behind the facts)

Future For Nature Academy is part of the Future For Nature organization and is created to form a network for young conservationists, experienced conservationists and conservation organizations. Visit www.ffnacademy.org or the Future For Nature Academy Facebook site for updates.

Nature Today is an inspiring platform that shares news about nature. Articles are written by nature organizations and scientific institutions. There is a Dutch version and recently also an International version started. Please contact me if you have experiences and/or results to share about whats happening in nature! @NatureTodayINT
I am an editor for paper submissions to the journal of Animal Behaviour. I invite reviewers, evaluate the paper myself and make the final decision.
